For this reason she is requesting a loan of 2000 somoni which she will use to purchase cement, lumber and other building supplies. Dilnoza hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and lumber for repairing her house

loans.name: Jenelen

texts.en:
Jenelen is 39 years old and has four children, three of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Jenelen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a widowed woman who has been blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanalima has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Maribel works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Maribel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and pay maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Maribel has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and pay maintenance for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 35-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop for years and he started the business in order to raise money to meet his family's basic needs. Customers failing to pay and price fluctuation pose a challenge to his business growth while his dreams are to buy land and make a good farm. 

Wilson intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as maize flour, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as maize flour, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is a 40-year-old married woman from the Philippines. She and her husband have two children. Her children are currently in school.

Faustina is in the agricultural business. Specifically, she raises pigs for a living. She has been in this line of business for 15 years.

Faustina is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She explains that she has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Faustina would like to save enough money so that she can send her children to college. She thanks lenders for their support.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with two children. Both of her children currently attend school. She lives with her family in their house, which has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over three years, she has been operating a beauty salon business. Her customers are neighbors and others in her town. She dreams of expanding her business into a beauty training school.

With the loan proceeds that she is requesting she wants to purchase hair extensions, hair treatments, and shampoo. She joined Yehu because of its favorable loaning requirements.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing hair extensions, hair treatments, and shampoo

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel, se ha decidido por otro crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de abono, plaguicidas, insecticidas y semilla, para tener los materiales necesarios que le faciliten la preparación del terreno para sembrar maíz y frijol.
El préstamo anterior le facilito la compra de insumos agrícolas, con lo que tuvo mejores ventas, una cosecha abundante y mejores ingresos; con los cuales ha cancelado deudas, aporto más para los gastos de su hogar y amplió su vivienda
texts.en:
Manuel has decided to take another loan which he will invest in the purchase of fertilizer, pest-control substance, insecticide and seeds to have the necessary material that will help him prepare the land to plant corn and beans.

The previous loan allowed him to purchase agricultural supplies with which he had higher sales, an abundant harvest and better revenues. This has allowed him to pay off his debts, contribute more to the household expenses and expand his house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pest-control substance, insecticide and seeds.

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es:
José, tiene 49 años de edad, es casado tiene dos hijos de 22 y 17 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos, se dedica a sembrar hortalizas como tomate, chile y ejote, pepino y pipián; además siembra granos básicos como maíz y frijol, su padre le enseño a desempeñar esta actividad y la ejerce desde que era un niño. Por su experiencia en el área ha podido administrar muy bien el negocio.
Invertirá en compra de semilla de tomate, pepino, ejote, abono plaguicidas y fertilizantes, espera aumentar el área de cultivo, incrementar la producción, aumentar sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos con los que cancelara las cuotas y dará mejora alimentación, salud y vestuario a su familia.
Sueña con tener un negocio muchos grande, enseñar a sus hijos a trabar en este rubro y aumentar la clase de productos que siembra.
texts.en:
Jose is 49 years old, married, and has two children, ages 22 and 17. He lives with his wife and children, and works growing vegetables such as tomatoes, chilies, green beans, cucumbers and squash, as well as basic grains such as corn and beans. He says that his father taught him how to farm, and that he has farmed since he was a small boy. He says that he has been able to manage the business well, because of his experience in this area.

Jose is requesting this loan to buy seeds for tomatoes, cucumbers and green beans, and to buy manure, pesticides and fertilizers. He hopes to increase the amount of land he has under cultivation, as well as increase his production, sales and income. He plans to use the income to make payments on the loan and to improve his family’s diet, health and clothing.

Jose’s dream is to have a larger business, to teach his children to work in this area and to grow a wider variety of products.

loans.use: to buy seeds for tomatoes, cucumbers, and green beans, and to buy manure, pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 51-year-old married woman. She is a mother of five children, and she is motivated to provide her family with quality food and clothing and to make sure that they are all healthy.

To earn a living, she has been running a small general store with her husband out of their house. She has three years of experience in this field. Her husband purchases stocks of goods from the market because he has developed many contacts over the years.

She is now hoping to grow her business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 45,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet her customers' increasing demands. She is expecting a boost in her earnings as a result of the loan, and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to expand her business and to meet customer demand by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages)

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman aged forty years with seven children all attending different schools in different areas. She lives in Kyotera town with her family and her mother whom she supports because of her advanced age. She owns a boutique where she sells all types of ladies’ wear and also has rentals which she considers as her side business. She stared her business in 1998.

She works 7 days a week and 14 hours per day and started her business to earn a living and get money to improve her standard of living. She has acquired this loan to complete construction of her rentals and her clients are ladies from Kyotera town.

Her future hopes are to enlarge her boutique and to construct more rentals and she faces the challenge of price fluctuation. She describes herself as an honest and hardworking woman who encourages lenders to continue helping business people.

loans.use: To complete construction of her rental properties.

loans.name: Hafeez

texts.en: Hafeez is a 40-year-old vigorous lady.  She has been stitching clothes from the past seven years. She stitches clothes for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers.  For this reason, she requested a Murabaha loan of Rs 25,000 to the Kashf Foundation. She utilized this loan amount to purchase more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. It allowed her to stitch up more dresses on time. She wishes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to allow her to stitch up more dresses on time for her customers.

loans.name: Tehseen

texts.en:
Tehseen is a 28-year-old married woman living in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a very hardworking and responsible housewife, who always helps her husband run their grocery store.

For many years, her husband has been running a grocery store, which is the only source of income for their family. Currently, he needs to purchase books, stationary, and other groceries for next year to continue to operate the store. But due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult to do so.

As a result, Tehseen is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She is confident that the loan proceeds will not only help her husband to expand his business but will also increase their net income and savings. Her goal is to provide quality education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: To expand and improve her husband's grocery store by purchasing books, stationery, and other grocery items

loans.name: Ghulam  Fatima

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima, 53 years old and married, has been running a small general store in her community for many years. Offering a variety of grocery items at  reasonable prices, she has gained and retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To fully stock her store and consistently meet increasing demand, Ghulam Fatima has requested a loan for Rs 30,000 to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Isaac's Group

texts.en:
Isaac lives in a home with mud walls, sand or dirt floor, and an iron roof in Musunji village in Vihiga, Kenya. He is 29 years old, works as a subsistence peasant farmer, and has 3 children. The community of Musunji village collects their drinking water from a protected spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of Vihiga Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Musunji’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination. In Musunji, 40 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Isaac has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are three other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Leah, Elijah and Beatrice.

Musunji village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Isaac believes that the dispenser will erase the need to boil water and therefore help his community to conserve the environment. He is looking forward to teaching his neighbors how to treat water and improve their health. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Isaac’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to install and maintain chlorine dispensers to provide access to safe drinking water for the community

loans.name: Naomi's Group

texts.en:
In Shaviringa B village in Vihiga, Kenya, Naomi has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Naomi is a friendly member of the community with 7 children. Naomi lives with her family in a house made of mud walls, sand or dirt floor, and an iron roof.

Shaviringa B village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Naomi and the 20 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Naomi has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Naomi volunteered to be the promoter because she thinks it is good to volunteer to help others and she wants to help the community by helping to make water safe and kill germs. There are also four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Caroline, Jane, Mary and Florence. 

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Naomi’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to ensure that the community has access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Faith's Group

texts.en:
In Bukhevera village in Vihiga, Kenya, Faith has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Faith is a goal-oriented, hard-working, well-liked member of the community with 2 sons who are 10 and 13 years old. Faith lives with her family in a house made of mud walls, sand or dirt floor, and an iron roof.

Bukhevera village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Faith and the 40 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Faith has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Faith volunteered to be the promoter because she is a people person and she wants to help the community by promoting good health. There are also four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Zipporah, Hezron, Peter and Loileen.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Faith’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to ensure that the community has access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Consolata's Group

texts.en:
Consolata lives with her family in a home with mud walls, sand or dirt floor, and an iron roof in Isukura B village in Vihiga, Kenya. She is 30 years old and has 3 daughters. The community of Isukura B village collects their drinking water from a protected spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of Vihiga Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Isukura B’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination. In Isukura B, 30 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Consolata has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Ann, Christine, Margaret and Pamela.

Isukura B village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Consolata believes that the dispenser will help the community access safe water and avoid diseases. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Consolata’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water

loans.name: Naftal's Group

texts.en:
Naftal is 50 years old, has 3 children, and lives in Jivudavaji village in Vihiga, Kenya. Jivudavaji village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Naftal and his family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Naftal works as a subsistence/peasant farmer, but has also volunteered his time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables his community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Naftal and other promoters in his community (including Bernadett, Rose, Francis and Linet) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Naftal will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Naftal wants to be a promoter because he cares for the environment and the well-being of the community. Naftal believes that the dispenser will prevent waterborne diseases by dispenser use, leading to improved lifestyles.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Naftal’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
In Mahanga B village in Vihiga, Kenya, Grace has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Grace is a goal-oriented, hard-working, well-liked member of the community with 5 children. Grace lives with her family in a house made of mud walls, sand or dirt floor, iron roof.

Mahanga B village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Grace and the 20 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Grace has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Grace volunteered to be the promoter because she didn't want to let the community down and she wants to help the community by killing germs in water. There are also four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Nancy, Carolyne, Mary and Catherine.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Grace’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to allow the community to treat their water to make it safe to drink using chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su ciclo 23, es un grupo bastante antiguo que viene trabajando juntas de manera unida y  luchando por mejorar, lleva por nombre mujeres unidas al progreso, ya que por eso justamente ellas se han unido, en busca del progreso de todas. Están formando parte también del programa de eliminación de pobreza, haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Esther, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, pero ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa que quiere empezar a mejorar. 
Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y pide este préstamo para poder comprar mas variedades de cosméticos, y así seguir con sus ventas y luchando por mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is in its 23rd loan cycle. The members have worked together for a long time in a cooperative manner as they strive to improve. For this reason, they have named themselves "Mujeres Unidas al Progreso" (United Women for Progress), which is quite appropriate since they are close-knit and all of them are looking to make progress. They are also participating in the poverty elimination program and have taken the poverty elimination survey.

One of the members is Sra. Esther, whose results indicated that she is at a Level 1 poverty stage. In other words, she has very low income. Through her work and effort, she continues to apply the essential behaviors that are characteristic of a successful woman so that she can begin to improve. Esther sells cosmetics and is requesting a loan in order to buy a wider variety of products. This will enable her to continue her sales and strive toward improving her income.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 27-year-old single man, who has worked in providing computer services and games since 2006.
He is a hard worker who provides several services to his customers at one time to make sure that his work is running properly.
In addition to computer and games services, Hassan provides photocopy services and he sells juice, too. He is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase the number of his computers which will expand his business through increasing his income.
He hopes to keep on developing his business to reply better to customers' needs and requests.

loans.use: To increase the number of his computers to expand his business.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: El señor Alberto  tiene 48 años, casado con dos hijos de 20 y 14 años, él se dedica a la fabricación de joyas de oro y plata,  se dedica a esta actividad hace bastante tiempo,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el señor Alberto    va a usar este préstamo para compra de materia prima como oro y plata para fabricación de joyas en especial anillos de promoción ya que estas fechas tiene muchos pedidos,  el señor Alberto  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su trabajo día a día, el  señor Alberto  tiene muchos pedidos  por realizar trabajos de muy buena calidad es una persona trabajadora se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar su trabajo y por ende sus ingresos económicos ya que con esta actividad mantiene a su familia.
texts.en:
Alberto is 48 years old, married and has two children ages 20 and 14. He makes gold and silver jewellery. He has been doing this work for quite a long time. 

This is his first loan in the institution. Alberto is going to use this loan to purchase raw material such as gold and silver to make jewellery especially class rings as they are in high demand at this time. 

Alberto faces challenges in his business; improving his day to day work. Alberto has many requests as his work quality is very good. He is a hard worker and is happy for this opportunity to improve his work and economic situation. He can support the family with this activity.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as gold and silver.

loans.name: Sadullo

texts.ru: Садулло 30 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Он живет вместе со своей семьей в отдаленном регионе. Садулло является основным кормильцем семьи, так как его жена домохозяйка, а его дети еще маленькие. Садулло более 3 лет занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Так как он живет в отдаленном регионе, сложная географическая структура района не позволяет развитию общественного транспорта. Садулло имеет своих клиентов. Он старается привлечь больше клиентов и предоставить свои услуги на лучшем уровне по более доступной цене. Он должен установить газ в свою автомашину и поэтому он обратился за займом. Садулло запрашивает займ на сумму 1700 сомони. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sadullo is 30 years old. He is married and is raising two children. He lives together with his family in a remote region. Sadullo is the main provider of the family as his wife is a home maker and his kids are still small. Sadullo has been working as a taxi driver for three years. As he lives in a remote region, the complex geographical structure of the area prevents the development of public transport. Because of this, Sadullo has many clients and is always trying to attract more clients as well as improve his service and make it affordable. To keep the fuel costs down Sadullo wants to improve his vehicle and install a natural gas fuel system, for which he requires this loan. He is requesting a loan of 1700 somoni. Sadullo awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to improve his taxi cab by installing a natural gas fuel system

loans.name: Sarvar

texts.ru: Сарвар трудолюбивая женщина. Она вдова и имеет одну дочь. Она сталкивалась со многими трудностями по обеспечению семьи. Сарвар не имеет высшее образование и поэтому она работает уборщицей в средней школе. Сарвар после работы возвращается домой и занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она имеет своих клиентов. Ее клиентами являются не только ее соседи, но и женщины с других кишлаков. Сарвар данное время нуждается финансовой поддержке. Ее дочь скоро выходит замуж и она должна провести ее свадебное торжество. Сарвар не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sarvar is a hard-working woman. She is a widow and has one daughter. Sarvar has faced many difficulties in providing for her family. She has no college degree and works as a cleaning lady in a middle school. After work Sarvar also sews traditional Tajik dresses from home. She has many clients. Her clients are not only her neighbors, but even women from other mountain villages. Currently Sarvar need financial assistance. Her daughter's wedding is coming up and Sarvar needs to pay for the wedding feast, but she has no savings. She is requesting a loan of 2000 somoni to pay for the wedding feast and she hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to finance the wedding party for her daughter

loans.name: Zarhol

texts.ru: Зархол родилась в 1962 года. Она педагог с огромным опытом. Зархол после окончания Педагогического университета в 1999 году поступила на работу в средней школе. Она по сей день работает в средней школе. Зархол преподает таджикский язык и таджикскую литературу. Она имеет хорошие знания и свою методику преподавания. Зархол заботливая мать 3 детей. Она сама обеспечивает своих детей, так как она рассталась с мужем. Зархол получает маленькую зарплату и поэтому она хочет организовать свой бизнес скотоводством и получать дополнительный доход. Зархол запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zarhol was born in 1962. She is a teacher with a lot of experience. After graduating from the Pedagogical University in 1999 Zarhol started working in middle school. She is still working there and teaches Tajik language and Tajik literature. She is very knowledgeable and has her own teaching methods. She is also a caring mother of three children. Zarhol is divorced and provides for her children by herself. As a teacher's salary is small, Zarhol wants to start a livestock business to supplement her salary. She is requesting a loan of 6000 somoni to buy cattle. Zarhol awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle for starting her new business

loans.name: Carolina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carolina, está satisfecha con los resultados que tiene al invertir créditos en su negocio, porque en esta ocasión solicita capital para adquirir papas, chiles, cebollas, guineos, peras, fresas, repollos, etc., con lo que diversificara sus inventario y podrá ofrecer más productos a sus clientes en esta temporada en la cual tiene mayor de manda.
Tuvo un efecto muy positivo con el crédito anterior, pudo incluir una variedad de productos nuevos en el negocio, tiene a clientes más satisfechos, sus ventas aumentaron, ha podido cancelar deudas y da a su familia mejores condiciones en cuanto alimentación, salud y vesturio.
texts.en:
Carolina is satisfied with the results she gets from investing loans in her business.  At this time, she is requesting capital to acquire potatoes, chilies, onions, bananas, pears, strawberries, cabbages etc.  With them, she will diversify her inventory and be able to offer more products to her customers.  This is the season when demand is highest. 
The previous loan had a very positive effect.  Carolina was able to add a variety of new products to her business, her customers had increased satisfaction, her sales increased and she was able to pay off her debts.  Carolina was also be to improve her family's diet, health and wardrobe.

loans.use: to acquire potatoes, chilies, onions, bananas, pears, strawberries and cabbages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy five bags of potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Gor

texts.en:
Gor lives in Yerevan with his mother. For many years, Gor has been earning his living by preparing paper bags and selling them. Over these years of hard work, Gor has already gained a good client base that order paper bags only from him. Because of his family's difficult financial condition, Gor currently isn't able to purchase paper and cover printing costs. He asks for this loan to be able to purchase his required amount of paper and cover printing costs, which will give him an opportunity to complete his clients' orders. 

Gor has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with easy conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Gor hopes for lenders' support and will be very grateful to them for their help.

loans.use: to pay for paper and cover printing costs.

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Mbalu from Waterloo2, in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married and blessed with one child. She began her business because she wanted to improve her status of living. In 2006, Mbalu established her general store business. She works at the business from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation, and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Mbalu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business, and renovate her shop. In the future, Mbalu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks, and pure water.

loans.name: Edik

texts.en: Edik is from Masis town. He has worked as a taxi driver for over fifteen years, driving his own car. He lives with his wife, who is a doctor by profession. Currently the car that Edik has been running as a taxi is damaged. He was able to save money for purchasing a new one, but because of his family's poor conditions wasn't able to save the whole needed amount. Now, by applying for this loan, Edik asks for a loan of AMD 500,000 to be able to purchase a new car and continue his taxi-driving business. Edik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will help Edik very much and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a new car

loans.name: Mubarak

texts.ru: Мубарак 53 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Двое детей студенты, учатся в столице Кыргызстана в университете. Двое младших детей проживают с родителями. У Мубарак - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Мубарак занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Мубарак, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 10 овец. Супруг занимается перевозкой грузов и имеет тоже небольшой доход. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мубарак обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Мубарак планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на улучшение материального обеспечения семьи.
texts.en:
Mubarak is 53 years old, married and raising four children together with her husband. Two of the children are students, studying at the university in the capital of Kyrgyzstan. The two youngest children live with their parents. 

Mubarak has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she works with livestock breeding, after having started 20 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Mubarak's persistent work, her farm currently has three dairy cows and 10 sheep. Her husband works with transport of cargo and does not have a large income either. The total monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Mubarak turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan to purchase sheep for increasing the number of livestock. Mubarak plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock. She also plans to save money for increasing the material well-being of the family.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Hellen is 42 years old, has 2 children, and lives in Gimaswaji village in Vihiga, Kenya. Gimaswaji village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Hellen and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Hellen works as a business owner, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Hellen and other promoters in her community (including Emily, Joseph, Joseph, and Aggrey) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Hellen will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Hellen wants to be a promoter because her people chose her and she is willing to serve the community. Hellen believes that the dispenser will prevent diseases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Hellen’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to reduce the burden of water-borne diseases by providing access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en: Raheela is a 34-year-old married lady who has been running a small general store at her home for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan for PKR 30,000, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Martin's Group

texts.en:
Martin is 40 years old, has 2 children, and lives in Gidagada village in Vihiga, Kenya. Gidagada village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Martin and his family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Martin works as a commercial farmer and actively serves the community daily, but has also volunteered his time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables his community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Martin and other promoters in his community (including Beth, Mary, Mary, and Grace) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Martin will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Martin wants to be a promoter because he believes that the dispenser will help reduce diseases especially diarrhea.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Martin’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water

loans.name: Zuhura's Group

texts.en:
In Jong'Ondi village in Vihiga, Kenya, Zuhura has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Zuhura is a friendly, goal-oriented, reliable and well-liked member of the community with 2 children. Zuhura lives with her family in a house made of mud walls, sand or dirt floor, and an iron roof.

Jong'Ondi village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Zuhura and the 12 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Zuhura has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Zuhura volunteered to be the promoter because she is good with people and she wants to help the community by killing germs in drinking water. There are also three other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Gladys, Daniel, and Joyce.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Zuhura’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to reduce the burden of water-borne diseases by providing access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama is a 31-year-old married woman who runs a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has two cows, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. Salama has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 25,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Salama is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow to sell milk.

loans.name: Minicah's Group

texts.en:
Minicah is 38 years old, has 4 children, and lives in Kamuguywa village in Vihiga, Kenya. Kamuguywa village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected dug well. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Minicah and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Minicah works as a subsistence/peasant farmer, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Minicah and other promoters in her community (including Nifreda and Judith) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Minicah will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Minicah wants to be a promoter because she likes to help and educate her community on the importance of treating water. 

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Minicah’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to allow the community to treat their water to make it safe to drink using chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Fridah's Group

texts.en:
Fridah is 57 years old, has 5 children, and lives in Jepkwony village in Vihiga, Kenya. Jepkwony village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from an unprotected well. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Fridah and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Fridah works as a business owner and actively participates in the village credit savings and women's groups, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Fridah and other promoters in her community (including Amisi, Aggrey, Phanice and Cyrus) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Fridah will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Fridah wants to be a promoter to help others live healthy lives with no waterborne diseases. She believes that the dispenser will kill germs that cause sickness and consequent hardship.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Fridah’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to reduce the burden of water-borne diseases by providing access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 57-year-old, married woman and the mother of five children. The man shown in the photo is Amina’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional use. For this reason, Amina has applied for a loan of Rs 25,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers. Amina is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is 43-years-old. He is married with two children. One of them is a 13-year-old boy who goes to seventh grade class and the other is a 10-year-old daughter who goes to fourth grade class. Khalil’s wife is a history teacher in the local school. His family are IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from their native land already 20 years ago. Now they live in the Mehdiabad settlement of Baku region.

He opened his new business. Now Khalil rents a store where he plans to sell fish, poultry meat and other meat products. Khalil rents a store and bought a fridge. Now he needs a loan amount of 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy products which he wants to sell in this store.
He is greatly thankful to the Komak and Kiva organizations for a loan to help increase his business. In the future he wants to buy a store to increase his monthly income.

loans.use: to buy products to sell in his store.

loans.name: Majida

texts.en:
Majida is a 43-year-old married mother of two children. She has been running her convenience store since five years ago. It is an important source of living for her beloved family, since her husband has a very low-income business.

Majida is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua for the first time, to increase her business merchandise with special released detergents highly requested by her customers. She might also invest part of the loan in buying special offered products, which will attract customers' attention and increase her selling.

She hopes to stay capable of responding to her customers’ needs to make sure that she can easily cover her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special released detergents highly requested by her customers.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: La Sra. Reina tiene 25 años, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado porcino ella  vive en la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Reina va a usar este préstamo para compra de cerdos para crianza para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar sus ingresos,  La Sra. Reina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su negocio y calidad de vida y va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar alimento balanceado para sus ganado y así de esta manera poder tener más producción, La Sra. Reina es una persona joven con ganas de seguir adelante se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos ya que esta es la única actividad a la que se dedica.
texts.en:
Reina, 25, buys and sells pigs. She lives in El Torno. This is her first loan with the institution. She is going to use this loan to purchase pigs to raise for her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is to improve her profits. She faces challenges in her business; improving her business and quality of life. 

Reina will use the loan to purchase balanced feed for her livestock in order to have more production. She is a young person with a desire to get ahead. She is grateful for this opportunity presented to her to improve her business and her economic situation, as this is her only work.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Isabellah

texts.en:
Meet Isabellah, a resident farmer in Kisii who is married and has six children. She has been doing farming for 12 years, and she produces and sells milk, eggs and tea. To her, farming is a lifestyle and a source of income for her family. At times, she experiences poor roads and the lack of a market for her produce.

Isabellah chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they are client-friendly and offer good services to their clients. She learnt that MFIs (microfinance institutions) offer loans at low interest rates. 

This loan will enable her to purchase a dairy cow, leading to an increase in milk production. This will increase their income base, and thus she will be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nongue Taaba Group

texts.fr:
Mr HAMIDOU est responsable du groupe NONGUE TAABA. Marié, il n’a pas d’enfant. Il a 02 personnes en charge.
Mr  stock les plastiques et tout ce qui est fer depuis 03ans. Ce sont les jeunes qui circulent  avec des charrettes pour acheter et ramener à son magasin. Ses clients sont ceux qui recyclent  les plastiques  et ceux qui fondent le fer.
Il veut s’acheter 03tonnes de fer.
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans sa activité. Il ambitionne agrandir son magasin et construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en: Mr. Hamidou is the head of the Nongue Taaba group. He is married with no children. He is responsible for two people. Mr. Hamidou has been stocking up on plastics and everything made from iron for three years. Young people bring their carts to buy and bring back items from his store. His customers recycle plastic and melt iron. He wants to buy 3 tons of iron. Mr. Hamidou wants to reinvest his earnings into his business. He hopes to expand his store and build a house.

loans.use: to buy 3 tons of iron

loans.name: Margar

texts.en: Margar is a father of two children and lives with his family in the town of Kapan in the Syuniq region of Armenia. For the past two years, Margar has been in the business of buying and selling car parts. He purchases old and used cars and sells their different parts. Now that he knows this business is profitable enough to sustain his family, Margar wants to continue. Because of the financial hardships he is currently facing, Margar is requesting this loan to purchase a used car. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important for Margar to continue in his business and be able to ensure a better life for his wife and children.

loans.use: to pay for a used car to sell its parts.

loans.name: Darcy Yahoska

texts.es: Darcy tiene 40 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Es madre soltera de dos hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de mercadería variada (cristalería, juguetes, ropa etc.). Inicio este negocio hace muchos años, primeramente vendiendo golosinas en forma ambulante, y luego decidió adquirir préstamos para tener su negocio. Actualmente cuenta con la venta de mercadería variada, la cual le ha generado buenas ganancias. Su meta es tener una tienda de calzado. Solicita el crédito para comprar artículos navideños: luces, arboles, adornos de santas, entre otros, con el fin de ofertar mercaderías navideñas de acuerdo a la temporada y demanda de sus clientes.  Estima que este crédito será beneficioso ya que obtendrá ganancias debido a las ventas y el alta demanda de los clientes. Su plan es extender su negocio.
texts.en:
Darcy is 40 years old and is originally from the city of Managua. She is a single mother of two children. She works selling different types of merchandise (glassware, toys, clothes, etc.). She started this business many years ago, first selling candy as a street vendor. Later on she decided to take on a loan to have her own store. Now she sells varied goods, which has generate good profit for her. Her goal is to have a shoe store.
Darcy is asking for a loan to purchase Christmas items (lights, trees, Santa decorations, etc) so she can offer Christmas merchandise in accordance with the season and with her customers' demands. Darcy believes that this loan will be beneficial for her because she will obtain profit due to the sales and the high demand from her customers. Her plan is to extend her business.

loans.use: to purchase Christmas items: lights, trees, Santa decorations, etc.

loans.name: Bermet

texts.ru: Бермет 47 лет, вдова одна с трудом воспитала 6 детей. Бермет рано осталась без мужа и кормильца семьи, а дети без отца. Тяжело пережив смерть и утрату близкого человека Бермет взяла себя в руки и начала строить планы: как же прокормить семью? Как поставить детей на ноги? А их шестеро... Как дать им достойное образование? Обсудив все эти вопросы со своими детьми, они решили отправить старшего сына в столицу Кыргызстана. У Бермет были небольшие денежные накопления, она отдала их старшему сыну и сын начал заниматься торговлей вещами на рынке. У него это хорошо получилось и ежемесячно он высылает доходы своей семье в село. А Бермет в это время не сидит сложив руки и в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством. Развитием животноводства  Бермет начала заниматься еще 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бермет, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бермет обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бермет планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Bermet is a 47 year old widow and she worked hard to raise her six children. Bermet became a widow very early and was left without a provider and a husband, and her children - without a father. It was hard to stop grieving the loss of her closest friend, but Bermet took a hold of herself and made plans. How would she feed her family now? How will she raise her children? How will she provide all six children with an education? After discussing all of this with her children, the family decided to send the eldest son to the capital of Kyrgyzstan. Bermet gave her meager savings to her son and he was able to use that money to start a retail business at one of the markets. He has been having good luck and is able to send money monthly back to the village. Bermet is also working hard to provide for her children - she has a dairy business. The herd was started 20 years ago with 10,000 KGD. Bermet's hard work has expanded the herd to five milk cows and yields monthly profits of 10,000 som KGS. In order to further expand her herd, Bermet has turned to the micro-finance bank "Bai Tushum and partners" for a loan which she will use to buy more cows. She will use the profits from the loan to buy more livestock and save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замире 24 года, замужем, детей пока нет. У Замиры - среднее образование, проживает вместе с супругом и свекровью. Свекровь -пенсионерка, супруг помогает по хозяйству. Замира в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 3 года назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Замиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 15 овец. Также имеется свой сад в доме, в саду посажены очень много плодоносящих деревьев, таких как: абрикос, хурма, гранат. Также имеет небольшой земельный надел, на котором выращивают ячмень, пшеницу, кукурузу и помидоры. Замира вместе с супругом получают очень хороший урожай, так как у них есть опыт работы, а главное они с душой и сердцем относятся к своей работе. Каждый день рано утром супруг Замиры отгоняет свой скот на пастбище и отдает их чабану, вечером скот возвращается домой. За это время Замира чистит хлев, заготавливает сено, меняет воду. Дважды в год Замира стрижет шерсть своих овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Замира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Замира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на улучшение материального обеспечения своей семьи.
texts.en: Zamira is a married 24 year old with no children. Zamira has a high school education and lives with her spouse and mother-in-law. Her mother-in-law is a pensioner and her husband helps with the housework. Zamira is the main source of income for her family from raising livestock, which she began three years ago by buying a cow for 10,000 Kyrgyzstani Somoni. Thanks to Zamira's hard work, her farm now has two cattle and 15 sheep. Also she has her garden at home in which she has planted many fruit trees, such as: apricot, persimmon, and pomegranate. Also she has a small plot of land on which to grow barley, wheat, corn, and tomatoes. Zamira together with her spouse, prepared for a very good harvest because they have experience, and most importantly, they put their heart and soul into their work. Every day early in the morning Zamira's husband drives the cattle to pasture and gives them to the shepherd, every night the cattle return home. During this time, Zamira cleans the barn, harvests hay, and gets fresh water. Twice a year Zamira sheers the sheep for wool. Their monthly income is 10,000 Kyrgyzstani Somoni. In order to further develop their farm, Zamira appealed to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to purchase sheep for livestock breeding. With the income from the loan, Zamira plans to invest further in multiplying their amount of domesticated animals, and plans to accumulate funds for material support of the family.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Tsu-Shitoo Group

texts.en:
These females are part of a group called 'Tsu-shitoo' group and are into the sale of clothing, provisions, cutlery sets and fish. These are made up of women who are very familiar with the institution's program. They are very active with their businesses, notably small retail. They all live in the same district and enjoy good relations.

Abigail (standing on the far right of the picture) is the group's featured borrower. She sells ladies clothing at the central market of Accra. She plans to use this new loan to get her customers new ladies clothing with the latest design. She wants to use the profits she makes to build up more substantial savings in order to be able to ask for a much bigger loan, so that she can expand her business and is better able to take care of her child. She is married and has one child.

They need a total amount of GHS 3,050 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to get her customers new ladies clothing with the latest design.

loans.name: Relwende 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme HAOUA est responsable du groupe RELWENDE 2. Mariée, elle a 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. Les 04 vont à l’école.
Mme est gérante de kiosque depuis plus de 17ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les boutiques et au marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont hommes, femmes et jeunes.
Elle veut s’acheter 01sac de farine de blé, 01bidon d’huile et 01sac de sucre pour préparer des gâteaux qu’elle vent en même tant dans son  kiosque.
Mme veut épargner et réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne agrandir son kiosque.
texts.en: Mrs. Haoua is the head of the Relwende 2 group. She is married with four children. The eldest is 19 and the youngest is 4. All four attend school. Mrs. Haoua has been managing a kiosk for more than 17 years. She stocks up in small shops and at the neighborhood market. Her customers are men, women, and youth. She wants to buy a sack of wheat flour, a container of oil, and a sack of sugar with which to make cakes to sell in her kiosk. Mrs. Haoua wants to save and reinvest her earnings into her business. She hopes to expand her kiosk.

loans.use: to buy a sack of wheat flour, a container of oil, and a sack of sugar with which to make cakes to sell in her kiosk

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 45-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for four years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation. 

She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue so that she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her third loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, packs of laces, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Raydan

texts.en:
Raydan is a 20-year-old single man who established, a year ago, his own mobile sales shop to improve his living conditions and increase his income. Raydan is a hard worker who is well known in his region with his hard work and special talent in his domain. Many of his customers are neighbors, relatives and friends who support him a lot to expand his work sector, and he wants to better respond to their needs.

Raydan is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his business merchandise with new mobile phone accessories and prepaid cards. He is very sure that this loan will improve his income and will reply to many of his customers' needs.

Raydan is working hard to expand his work sector, through increasing his business capital and starting wholesale trade in the near future.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with new mobile phone accessories and prepaid cards

loans.name: Dianke's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  est créé lors de l’inauguration du banc villageois, il regroupe des femmes du même village de plus elles partagent des liens de parentés ce qui facilite la cohésion et la solidarité. Elles sont très dynamiques et  ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Dianké  (milieu dans cette prise de vue), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Malgré son jeune âge c’est une femme d’une détermination exemplaire dans la gestion du groupement et dans ses activités personnelles. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Son activité s’inscrit dans la vente de produits alimentaires divers et variés : lait, sucre, riz, assaisonnement et bonbon pour enfant.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d’acheter un sac de 25 Kg de lait en poudre, un à deux sacs de sucre et divers autres produits alimentaires.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte soutenir son mari dans la gestion des charges de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was created with the inauguration of the banc villageois, which brings together women from the same village. They also share family connections, which facilitates the cohesion and solidarity of the group. They are very energetic and are in the business of selling things.

Mrs. Dianké  (in the center), is the star borrower of the group. Despite her young age, she is a very determined woman in managing her professional and personal life. She is a married mother of three children. She is in the business of selling diverse and varied food products: milk, sugar, rice, seasonings, and children’s candy.

Her new loan will allow her to buy a sac of 25 kg of powdered milk, 1-2 sacks of sugar, and other miscellaneous food products. 

With her profits, she plans to support her husband in managing their household expenses.

loans.use: to buy a sac of 25 kg of powdered milk, 1-2 sacks of sugar, and other miscellaneous food products

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Con 63 años de edad Paula sigue trabajando muy duro para mantener a su familia y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad y le colaboran con la economía de su hogar. Paula se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado de su localidad. Tiene 12 años de tener dicho negocio y es el que le ha permitido llevar el sustento a su hogar.  Dado que su familia es grande y su casa muy pequeña desea construir un cuarto para el cual necesita un financiamiento ya que no cuenta con el capital disponible para hacerlo por su cuenta. Solicita este crédito a FUSIA para invertir en la compra ladrillo, hierro, cemento, arena y grava para comenzar la construcción del cuarto lo antes posible. Expresa tener la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica.
texts.en: At age 63, Paula continues to work very hard to support her family and improve her living conditions.  She lives under very humble conditions with her husband and four adult children who help with the household finances.  Paula sells vegetables in the local market and has been doing this for 12 years, which allows her to support her household.  Given that her family is large and her house is very small she wants to build a room and she needs financing because she doesn’t have the money herself.  She is asking for a loan through FUSIA so she can buy bricks, iron bars, cement, and gravel so she can begin building the room as soon as possible.  She says that she will be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela continua dedicándose a la agricultura, a la ganadería, a la artesanía y a la crianza de animales menores, ella continua teniendo el pequeño taller en su domicilio donde elabora diferentes tipos de tejidos como por ejemplo chompas, chalinas y pasadizos. 

Ella participa en uno de los bancos comunales de la Asociación Arariwa  porque es una persona responsable y alegre. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo lana de alpaca y de oveja. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Adela continues to work in agriculture, in cattle ranching, in handicraft and in small animal raising. She still has her small workshop in her house where she makes different types of knitting for example sweaters, scarves and hallway rugs.

She participates in one of the communal banks of the Asociación Arariwa  (Arariwa Association) because she is responsible and happy. 

At this time she is requesting a loan to purchase materials for her work for example alpaca and sheep wool. She is grateful to everyone for this loan and promises to pay the monthly installments on time.

loans.use: to buy working material, such as alpaca and sheep wool.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is 50 years old, married to Alice, who is a farmer, and together they are blessed with one child aged 15 years old.

Musa is a blacksmith and in the tinsmith business in Ndunyu Njeru. He has been running the business for ten years and has applied for his first loan of KES.50,000 from KADET LTD to enable him to buy materials for his business. With anticipated profit, he plans to invest back in his business and also expand his farming business.

He hopes to expand his business to a large-scale one in the near future.

loans.use: To buy anvils and power hammers.

loans.name: Vioctoria

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Dinámicas y Talentosas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio San Pedro en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Victoria, tiene 59 años de edad, está separada  y de esta relación tienen 5 hijos todos mayores de edad y comprometidos, dos de ellos  viven en su casa pero de forma independiente.
Doña Victoria para salir adelante  con los gastos del hogar sin depender de nadie se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, allí mismo ella también tiene un pequeño bar en el cual vende todo tipo de bebidas,  trabaja todos los días ya que es la única forma de salir delante de una manera honrada y honesta. Son más de 10 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual saco adelante a sus hijos y ahora le permite salir adelante ya que esta sola.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, camisas y ropa de niños que es lo que más vende en esta época de Navidad y Año Nuevo que se avecina. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 9 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener buena salud para seguir adelante ella sola.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Dinámicas y Talentosas" (Dynamic and Talented) meets every two weeks in the San Pedro neighborhood of Manta.  Manta is a city known for its beautiful beaches frequented all year round and for being a city of unmatched beauty with many tourist attractions. 
This is where señora Victoria lives.  She is 59-years old, separated and has five grown, married children.  Two of her children live independently, but in her home.  
In order to get ahead of the household expenses without depending on anyone else, doña Victoria sells clothing.  She sells all types of clothing door-to-door and also from her home when customers come to her.  In addition, doña Victoria has a small bar from which she sells all types of beverages.  She works every day, as that is the only honest and honorable way for her to get ahead.  Doña Victoria has been making her living in this way for more than ten years.  It is how she helped her children to get ahead and now it allows her to make it on her own. 
This loan is going to be used to purchase pants, shirts and children's clothing, which is what she sells the most of in this Christmas and coming New Year season.  Doña Victoria has been with her communal bank for nine years, and she likes it for the help they have given with loans.  Her dream is to have good health to keep moving forward on her own.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es:
Rosa, opta por invertir nuevamente, en esta ocasión comprara pescado, conchas, jaibas, naranjas, zanahorias, papayas, repollos entre otros, para tener un negocio surtido para estas festividades en las que por las graduaciones escolares y fiestas de fin de año aumentan las ventas. 
Con la inversión anterior obtuvo mucho más clientes satisfechos, sus ventas aumentaron, ha incluido venta de verduras, los ingresos fueron mejores, el negocio creció y su familia tiene un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is opting to invest once again.  This time she will buy fish, shellfish, crabs, oranges, carrots, papayas, and cabbage, among others.  She will do this to have her business stocked for the school graduation festivities and the end of the year parties that increase sales.

With the previous investment she got many more satisfied customers, her sales increased, she has included vegetable sales, the profits were better, the business grew, and her family has a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fish, shellfish, crabs, oranges, carrots, papayas, and cabbage, among others.

loans.name: Aghasi

texts.en:
Aghasi lives with his mother. A doctor by profession, Aghasi drives a taxi to support his family. As the only man in the family, Aghasi feels very responsible for supporting his mother and giving her appropriate living conditions. 

Aghasi drives a taxi using his own car, but unfortunately it is damaged. It needs to be renovated but Aghasi has no saved money. He has applied for this loan to be able to renovate the car and purchase four tires. Aghasi has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important for Aghasi and he hopes that lenders will give him an opportunity to continue his taxi-driving business and earn income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of his car used as a taxi and buy four tires

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra, es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí. Es de oficio comerciante, antes se dedicaba al negocio al salón de belleza pero poco a poco logro comprar un molino y a este le ha convertido en su actividad principal. Esta agradecida con Kiva y MiCrédito ya que logro incrementar la demanda de sus clientes por su servicio de calidad. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: piezas de repuestos para su molino, entre otros con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le ayudará mejorar el ambiente de su negocio. Su plan futuro es montar otro molino en otro barrio para captar más clientela.
texts.en:
Mayra is from the city of Estelí, and she is a merchant.  Her business used to be a beauty salon.  However, little by little, she managed to buy a mill.  This has become her main business activity.

She is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito because she managed to increase her customer demand through her quality service.  She is requesting a new loan to buy replacement parts for her mill, among others.  She will do this in order to give her customers better service.  She feels that the loan will help her improve the atmosphere of her business.  Her plan for the future is to set up another mill in another neighborhood in order to gain more clientele.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for her mill, among others.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo2, eastern area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with two children.  She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. In 2010, Fatmata established her general store business.  She works at the business from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks and Pure Water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her shop. In the future, Fatmata plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks and Pure Water.

loans.name: Promise Group

texts.en:
These females are part of a group called 'Promise Group’ and are into the sale of new wax-prints and cooking utensils. The group is made up of women who are very familiar with the institution's program. 

They are very active with their businesses that are small retail. They all live in the same district and enjoy good relations.

Rose (standing on the left in the picture) is the group's featured borrower. She sells new wax-print clothing in Teshie-Accra. She plans to use this new loan amount of 2,200 GHS to provide her customers the latest design of wax-prints in the market. She wants to use the profits she makes to build up more substantial savings in order to be able to ask for a much bigger loan, so that she can expand her business and better be able to take care of her child. She is married and has one child.

They need a total amount of 6,500 GHS to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To get her customers the latest design of wax-prints in the market.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Zainab from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with three children. She began her business because she wants to get her daily living.
