In 2009, Zainab established her retail business. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Zainab requires a loan in order to purchase juice and bread for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children’s school fees. 

In the future, Zainab plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase juice and bread for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy household items.

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.en: Mamlakat is 44 years old. She has been married for over 24 years and has two children. Her family was displaced from Fuzuli city and now live in the Darnagul settlement in Baku; they are classified as IDP (Internally Displaced Persons). Her son is 21 years old and is studying his third course at university and her 18 year old daughter is studying her second course at medical college. Mamlakat’s husband is a seller in the market. Sometime ago Mamlakat started a business selling clothes from her house. Mamlakat sells baby clothes and a variety of woman clothes. Now Mamlakat is planning to expand her business and for this reason she is requesting a loan of 2,300 AZN to buy new seasonal clothes. Mamlakat is thankful for the aid of Komak and Kiva. In the future she wants to open a store to increase her business and monthly income.

loans.use: to buy new seasonal clothes to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida, a farmer from the village of Anipemza in Shirak region, lives with her husband, two school-age daughters, ages 10 and 8 years, and three-year-old-son, all shown in the photo. 

Aida's husband works in the village local school. His salary, however, is not enough to meet the needs of the family. To take care of her family's needs, Aida is engaged in cattle and sheep breeding, aviculture and beekeeping. With the help of her husband, Aida sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of their income. 

To continue running her agribusiness and to develop it further, Aida needs to make some investments. She has therefore requested a loan of USD 1800 to purchase 15 sheep as well as forage for cattle. 

As this is Aida’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have previous access to credit products because they have no credit history. 

Aida and her family will be very thankful to the lenders for their goodwill and support in extending the needed amount.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sheep and forage for cattle

loans.name: Jose Santos Jacobo

texts.es:
José, está acompañado, vive con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos  13 y 10 años de edad, es responsable de cubrir los gastos de su hogar, no cuenta con ayuda dl extranjero. Se dedica a la herrería, es un negocio que atiende él solo, su horario de atención al público es por desde bien temprano hasta la tarde, a partir de las 3:00 p.m. hasta las 9:00p.m. Aprovecha para hacer sus productos, para luego venderlos.
Comprará hierro, para elaborar las cumas que luego comercializa con sus clientes, espera tener una buena producción, aumentar sus ventas, tener más clientes, mejorar sus ingresos, cancelar puntualmente sus cuotas y mejorar su economía.
Su sueño es reparar y mejorar su vivienda para que su familia tenga un lugar seguro donde vivir.
texts.en:
José is married and lives with his wife and two children, who are 13- and 10-years old respectively.   José  has the responsibility of covering the household expenses- he does not have any outside help.  He makes his living as a blacksmith.  He tends to the business himself and is open to the public from very early in the morning until the afternoon.  From 3:00p.m. until 9:00p.m. he takes advantage of the time to make the items he will later sell. 
José will purchase iron to make knives, which he will later sell to his customers.  He hopes to have a good production, to increase his sales, to have more customers, to improve his income, to punctually pay off his loan and to improve his finances. 
José's dream is to repair and make improvements to his home so that his family can have a safe place to live.

loans.use: to purchase iron.

loans.name: Ainur

texts.ru: Айнур 32 года, не замужем, одна воспитывает сына школьного возраста, проживает Айнур со своими родителями-пенсионерами. Несмотря на свой пожилой возраст, родители помогают Айнур в ее бизнесе. У Айнур - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айнур занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айнур, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова с теленком. Хозяйство Айнур находится в своем доме, имеются все условия для содержания скота. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнур обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Айнур планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Ainur is 32 years old, not married, and raising a son of school age by herself. They live together with Ainur's parents, who are retired. Despite their age, Ainur's parents help her with her business. Ainur has secondary education. 

As a main source of income for her family, Ainur works with livestock breeding, after having started five years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Ainur's persistent work, her farm currently has a dairy cow with offspring. Ainur's farm is at her house, where she has conditions for breeding livestock. The monthly income is 5,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Ainur turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan to purchase bull-calves to fatten and subsequently sell at the market for a higher price. Ainur plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock, and intends to save money for repairing the house.

loans.use: to purchase bull-calves for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram is an experienced agronomist from Lusakert village of Shirak region. His family consists of his wife, daughter and son. The latter is currently in military service in the army. Aram is employed in the government sector; he is the deputy head of the village self governance body. His salary alone, however, is not enough to cover the everyday needs of the family. 

With the help of his family members Aram is engaged in breeding livestock: a cow, piglets, and hens, and in the cultivation of wheat. He sells the agricultural produce in the local market, and that is an important source of the family’s income. To continue running his agricultural business in a sustainable way, Aram currently needs a loan of USD 2000 to purchase potato seeds to start cultivation of potatoes and to buy some fertilizers. Aram and his family sincerely rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds to start cultivation of potatoes and to buy some fertilizers

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru:
Бахтиёр  проживает в сельской местности. Ему 35 лет. Бахтиёр многодетный отец. У него четверо  детей, он очень заботливый папа и любящий муж. Жена Бахтиёра  домохозяйка, ухаживает дома за скотами и перерабатывает молочные изделия. Готовые молочные продукты раздает соседям по оптовой цене. Вот так и развивается маленький бизнес жены Бахтиёра.
 Бахтиёр с детство любил животных, ухаживал за ними с любовью, с заботой. Переживал за каждого теленка. Повзрослев он начал заниматься откормом и купли продажей КРС и МРК и по сей день продолжает свою деятельность. Дополнительный доход  Бахтиёра  от реализации  сельскохозяйственных культур. У него в поле имеется не большое место. Но работа на поле сезонная, а основной их семейный доход от откорма и продажи скатов. 
Бахтиёру для зимнего периода чтобы утеплить коровник не хватает денежных средств. Поэтому он во второй раз повторно хочет взять  деньги  в кредит с МДО "Арванд". На полученный кредит Бахтиер хочет купить печку чтобы утеплить коровник. Заранее благодарит.
texts.en:
Bahtiyor is 35 years old and lives in a rural area. He has four children and is a very caring father and husband. His wife is a homemaker and also takes care of the cattle and processes dairy products. She is developing a small business selling the prepared dairy products to neighbors at wholesale prices.

Bahtiyor has loved animals since childhood and takes loving care of them, worrying over each calf. While growing up he began buying, fattening, and reselling cattle and sheep and has continued to this day. He earns additional income selling crops but does not have much land. Crops are seasonal, though, and the family's main income comes from fattening and selling livestock.

Bahtiyor doesn't have enough money to insulate his barn for winter, so he wants to take out a second loan with MDO Arvand in order to buy a stove to warm the barn. Bahtiyor thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy a stove to heat his barn for winter

loans.name: Henrik

texts.en:
Henrik is a young farmer from Haykadzor village, Shirak region. His family consists of his parents and two brothers. His younger brother is currently in the military service in the army. Henrik's father has gone to Russia as a labor migrant; he works there and sends money to the family to take care of their needs. 

With the help of his mother and brother, Henrik is extensively engaged in agricultural business. He is involved in cattle breeding, in aviculture, in breeding sheep, pigs, and piglets, and in cultivation of wheat. With the help of his family members Henrik sells the agricultural produce in the local market, which is the most important source of their income. 

As the winter is very close, Henrik needs to make some investments to prepare his agricultural business for the winter. A loan of USD 3000 will be a huge support to this young hard-working farmer and his family, enabling him to purchase barley seeds, buy some fertilizers, purchase forage for the livestock, and to buy fuel for agricultural machinery. 

Henrik and his family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase barley seeds, to buy some fertilizers, purchase forage for the livestock, and to buy fuel for agricultural machinery

loans.name: Zeynegul

texts.ru: Зейнегул 43 года, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Супруг работает электриком, получает небольшую зарплату, которая недостаточна для содержания всей семьи, поэтому в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Зейнегул, как и другие местные жители ее села, решила заняться животноводством, стартовав 8 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. И у нее это неплохо получилось, благодаря упорному труду Зейнегул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова и 25 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,60 ГА, на котором выращивает ячмень и сено. Все условия для содержания скота у Зейнегул имеются. На сегодняшний день Зейнегул со своей семьей уже заготовила корма для своего скота в виде: 2 тележек сена и 100 снопов прессованного сена, а также она кормит скот ячменем, который выращивает на своем же земельном наделе. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зейнегул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку жеребят для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Зейнегул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на покупку автомашины для сына.
texts.en:
Zeynegul is 43 years old, married and raising three children. Her husband works as an electrician and receives a small salary, which is not enough to support the whole family. Therefore, as a main source of income for her family, Zeynegul decided to work with livestock breeding, like many other inhabitants in her village. She started 8 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som (KGS), and she now has a good income. 

Thanks to Zeynegul's persistent work, her farm currently has a dairy cow and 25 sheep, and also a plot of land of 1.60 hectares of land, on which she grows barley and hay. Zeynegul has good conditions for breeding cattle. Currently she and her family already prepared the fodder for her livestock: 2 carts of hay and 100 bundles of pressed hay. She also feeds the livestock with barley which she grows on her plot of land. The monthly income is 7,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Zeynegul turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan to purchase foals for fattening and subsequently selling at the market, at a higher price. Zeynegul plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock. She also intends to save money for purchasing a new car for her son.

loans.use: to buy foals for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Adel

texts.en: Adel is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child. He is specialized at repairing computers and started to work on that in 2007. In parallel, and in order to boost his income, he works in the Lebanese police department. In addition, his wife works as a philosophy teacher. Even with the money earned, Adel and his family are facing ghastly circumstances and that’s what pushes Adel to request a loan from Kiva partner Vitas. s.a.l. to purchase software licenses and tools. In that way, he will be able to perform his work more easily and meet his customer’s needs and therefore gain higher income.

loans.use: to purchase software licenses and tools.

loans.name: Sheroz

texts.ru: Шероз умный и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Шероз занимался предоставлением услуги такси. Этим бизнесом он зарабатывал мало денег, и он не мог обеспечить семью с хорошим условием проживания. Он этим бизнесом занимался в течение 4 лет. Недавно он открыл магазин, где продает автозапчасти. Шероз постепенно развевает бизнес. Он хочет увеличить оборотный капитал своего нового бизнеса, но не имеет достаточно денег. Шероз запрашивает займ на сумму 12000 сомони для покупки автозапчастей. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Sheroz is a smart and hard-working man. He is married and raising two children. With an aim to provide his family with all necessary means, Sheroz used to provide a taxi service. He earned little money from this business, and was not able to provide his family with good living conditions. He worked with this business for a period of four years. 

Not long ago Sheroz opened a store, where he sells vehicle spare parts. He develops his business gradually. He would like to increase the working capital of his new business, but does not have sufficient money. He requests a loan in the amount of 12,000 somoni to purchase vehicle spare parts. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for increasing the working capital of his new business

loans.name: Salomon

texts.en: Salomon is 58 years old. He is married and has six children. He has a cement selling business. With the requested loan, he would like to buy more cement to sell. Salomon plans to become a cement distributor in the future. The profits from his business will be used to provide food for his family.

loans.use: to buy more cement to sell.

loans.name: Aloysie

texts.en: Aloys is 45 years old. She is married with six children. She owns a salon and has been running the business for the past two years. With the loan, she wants to buy more salon equipment, such as clippers and shampoos. The profits from the business will be used to provide for the family.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment for use such as clippers and shampoos for sale.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Dinámicas y Talentosas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio San Pedro en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Raquel, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres  hijos de  14, 12 y 4 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en jardín de infantes. Su esposo es chofer y trabaja en una constructora.
Doña Raquel es una mujer que le gusta generara sus propios ingresos y con estos ayudar a su familia a salir adelante, ella hace 4 años atrás con la ayuda del primer crédito que recibió empezó un negocio, ella comenzó vendiendo ropa, después con la ayuda de los créditos también vende carteras y bisuterías con lo cual le quedan mejores ingresos los mismos que utiliza para darle una buena educación a sus hijos, ella sale a vender sus productos por las mañana ya que es cuando sus hijos están estudiando luego ya en la tarde tiene que ayudarles a sus pequeños en sus tareas. 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa más que todo ya que es lo que más vende en esta época. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio el cual le permite ganarse algo por el bienestar de sus hijos. Ella sueña con darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The community bank "Dinámicas y Talentosas" meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of San Pedro in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches, which people visit during every season of the year.  It is also known as a city of unequaled beauty and has many tourist attractions.

Raquel lives in this city.  She is 37 years old and has three children aged 4, 12 and 14.  The older two children are in school and the youngest child is in kindergarten.  Her husband is a driver and works for a construction company.

Raquel is a woman who likes to make her own income and thereby help her family get ahead.  She started a business four years ago with the help of the first loan that she received.  She began selling clothing, and then with the help of loans she also began selling wallets and jewelry. This led to increased income and has enabled her to provide a good education for her children.  She goes out to sell her products in the morning since that is when her children are in school, and in the afternoon she needs to help her little ones with their homework.

She will use this loan mostly to buy clothing, since clothing is what she sells most during this season.  She has been a member of the community bank for four years.  She likes being a member, since thanks to her first loan she was able to start her business, which allowed her to earn some income for the well-being of her children.  She dreams of providing a better life for her little ones.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Mariati

texts.en: Mariati is 20 years old. She is married with one child aged 4. She sells milk and has spent two years in the business. With the loan, she would like to buy more milk for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family. The picture shows the jerrycans that Mariati uses to collect milk before she sells it.

loans.use: to buy more milk for sale.

loans.name: Marie Josee

texts.en: Marie Josee is 36 years old. She is married with four children. She runs a milk center as her business. With the loan, she would like to buy more milk for sale. She expects to make more savings for a better future.

loans.use: to buy more milk for sale.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan, age 46, is from the Ozurgeti district. She is married with three grown children and she also takes care of her retired mother. Ketevan and her husband own a stall at the local open market and sell fruits and vegetables. They buy fresh products in bulk every morning and sell from their stall. Their earnings are modest and hardly enough for covering feeding and daily costs. 

In order to meet her increasing family expenses, Ketevan and her spouse plan to buy a van and start a transportation business. Specifically, Ketevan’s husband will serve the retailers from the open market and transport their products in the morning. They will also save on their own transportation costs and make deliveries easily. 

Ketevan hopes the family initiative will be successful and this will increase their income. She hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a van for product transportation for her and her husband's work

loans.name: Jypargul

texts.ru: Жыпаргул 33 года, замужем, вместе с супругом Алмазбеком воспитывают 4 детей. Дети все маленькие. Супруг частный строитель, занимается частными заказами строительства посезонно. У Жыпаргул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жыпаргул занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жыпаргул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы. В зимнее время Жыпаргул реализует молоко из дому, что доставляет ей неплохой доход. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жыпаргул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом  на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жыпаргул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт помещения для скота.
texts.en: Jypargul is 33 years old, married, and has four young children. Her spouse Almazbek is an independent contractor and takes individual construction orders seasonally. Jypargul has a high school education and raises farm animals as the main income for her family. She began five years ago when she purchased cattle for 3,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, she now has two dairy cows. In the winter she sells milk from home, which provides a pretty good income. She earns 10,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue developing her farm, Jypargul asked the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Jypargul plans to use the profit from the loan to invest in more livestock and to save enough money to repair her barn.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 20-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo2 in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with 2 children. She began her business because she wants to avoid idleness and create income to support the home. In 2012, Fatmata established her retail business.  She works at the business from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more items like palm oil and soap for her soap business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her status of living. In the future, Fatmata plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like palm oil and soap for her soap business.

loans.name: Kayirbubu

texts.ru: Кайырбубу 61 год, вдова одна воспитывает шестерых детей (5 девочек и 1 сын). Все пять дочерей замужем и проживают со своими семьями отдельно, сын женат и проживает в одном доме с Кайырбубу. У Кайырбубу - среднее образование, она очень доброжелательная и ответственная. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кайырбубу занимается животноводством, стартовав 17 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кайырбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы и 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кайырбубу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кайырбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на утепление дома.
texts.en:
Kayirbubu is 61 years old and a widow. She has raised six children, five daughters and one son. All five daughters are married and lives separately with their families. The son is married and lives in the same house as Kayirbubu. Kayirbubu has secondary education. She is very friendly and responsible. As a main source of income for her family, Kayirbubu works with livestock breeding, after having started 17 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Kayirbubu's persistent work, her farm currently has four dairy cows and a horse. The monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Kayirbubu turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan to purchase cows to increase the number of livestock. Kayirbubu plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock. She also plans to save money for insulating her house.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Meet Hannah, she is 45 years old and is from Waterloo2, in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married and has five children. In 2005, Hannah established her charcoal business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income. She works at her business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, seven days per week. She says that her business' main challenge is insufficient capital for expansion. Hannah requires a loan in order to purchase bags of charcoal to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Hannah plans to open a food stuffs table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Al-Tawhd Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Tawhd. It consists of four members . All of them are hardworking women. They are requesting a loan of 250,000 YER. 

Asia, one of the group members, is 37 years old and lives in Hodeidah, Yemen.  She is a divorced woman with three children. She sells incense and perfumes to customers who are her neighbors and friends. She started her business when she left her husband. She has had this business for five years. She is proficient in making incense and so her customers are comfortable with her. She requested a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy materials to make incense and perfumes  for her business. She hopes to improve her business in order to offer a good life to her family.

loans.use: to buy materials to make incense and perfumes  for her business.

loans.name: Kahramon

texts.ru: Кахрамон женат имеет двоих детей. Ему 25  лет. У него среднее образование.  Его жена домохозяйка занимается воспитанием детей. Эта молодая семья живет отдельно от родителей и по возможности родители помогают им. Кахрамон один несет ответственность за свою  растущую семью. У него свое дело. Он готовит и продает шашлык. У него хорошая репутация в  своей отрасли. Но фонд зарплаты для его семьи недостаточен  и в будущем   Кахрамон собирается расширить свое дело для того чтобы  обеспечить членов семьи всем необходимым.  Скоро зима, и Кахрамон хочет утеплять свое жилье.    Он хочет купить печку и угли.  Для этого ему не хватает денежных средств.   Он обратился в МДО «Арванд» за кредитом и надеется на поддержку. Заранее благодарит.
texts.en:
Kahramon is married and has two children. He is 25 years old. He has secondary education. His wife is a housewife, engaged with raising the children. This young family lives separately from their parents, but the parents help them when possible. 

Kahramon carries the responsibility for his growing family alone. He has his own business. He cooks and sells shashlik (kebabs). He has a good reputation in his industry. But his wage is not enough for his family, and Kahramon has decided to expand his business in the future, in order to support all members of his family with necessities. 

Soon it will be winter, and Kahramon would like to heat up his house. He would like to purchase a furnace and coal. He does not have enough money for this, and turned to MDO "Arvand" for a loan. He hopes for support and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy a furnace and coal

loans.name: Zahor Al-Salam Group

texts.en:
This group is called Zahor Al-Salam, and consists of 5 ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB. 

A`aida is 30-years-old and lives with her family. She is very ambitious and loves her family very much. She sells ladies’ clothes, incense, perfumes and other goods. She has been in this business for many years and is experienced in sales, which allows her to make a better income. 

She works hard to offer a good life for her family. She has a regular customer base, because they prefer the quality, affordable prices, and good service that she offers. She is a resourceful and honest woman, dedicated to her work. She applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB to buy clothes, incense, and perfumes for her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, incense, and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Paula Isidora

texts.es: Paula, es una mujer soltera trabajadora, sus hijos atienden su pequeño negocio de video juegos en horas libres en su casa de habitación, mientras ella atiende su empleo de conserje en una institución del estado, así es como Paula costea los gastos principales del hogar como los de sus hijos, de quienes espera puedan culminar sus estudios satisfactoriamente. Ella solicita este crédito con el fin de comprar dos equipos de video juegos para aumentar el número de maquinas y así mejorar un poco su economía, ya que aun con dos medios de ingresos, a veces se le dificulta cumplir con todos sus gastos diarios, ya que devenga un salario  mínimo.
texts.en: Paula is a hard-working single woman. In their free time, her children work at her little video game business, which is located in her home, while she works at her job as a caretaker at a state institution. This is how Paula covers the principal household expenses as well as those of her children, who she hopes can finish their studies satisfactorily. She is applying for this loan with the goal of buying two video game players to increase the number of machines that she has and thus improve her economic situation a little, since even with two means of income, it is sometimes difficult for her to meet all her daily expenses, since she earns a minimal salary.

loans.use: to buy two video game players for her business

loans.name: Hasna

texts.en: Hasna is a 50-year-old Lebanese widowed woman living by herself. In 1997, she started to work as a housekeeper cleaning out residences upon customer’s demands. Following her spouse passing away, she was forced to also work at a local company as a housekeeper with the aim of being able to meet life's necessities. And today, Hasna is eager to buy a stepladder, cleaning products and detergents to improve her work and end up with satisfying and agreeable results. To do so, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. and she is sure that it will definitely be useful for her and her business.

loans.use: to buy a stepladder, cleaning products and detergents

loans.name: Ana Delicia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Dinámicas y Talentosas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio San Pedro en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 4 y 1 años de edad, el mayor esta en jardín de infantes. El marido es albañil. 
Doña Ana con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos los mismos que le permiten ayudarle  a su marido a afrontar los gastos del hogar  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, ya que solo le toca llevar a su hijo más pequeño  mientras que el mayor estudia,  son 3 años que lleva con este negocio el cual le permite ayudar a su marido ya que el no gana mucho en su trabajo. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque con los créditos ella surte más su negocio y aprovecha las ofertas. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Dinámicas y Talentosas" (Dynamic and Talented) meets every two weeks in the San Pedro neighborhood of Manta.  Manta is a city known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented all year round and for being a city of unmatched beauty with many tourist attractions. 
This is where señora Ana lives.  She is 22-years old, married and has two children who are 4- and 1-years old respectively.  The oldest is in kindergarten.  Her husband is a bricklayer.  
With the objective of having her own income which  would also allow her to help her husband with the household expenses, doña Ana sells all types of clothing and Belcorp products (beauty supplies, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories).  She works every day, mostly in the mornings.  Mornings are easier for her because she only has to bring her younger son along while the older one is in school.  Doña Ana has been running her business for three years.  It allows her to help her husband, as he doesn't make much in his work.  
This loan is going to be used to purchase clothing, perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics and lotions.  Doña Ana has been with her communal bank for two years.  She likes it because with the loans she can stock up her business even more and take advantage of sales.  Her dream is to give all the best to her little ones.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics and lotions.

loans.name: Norma Beatriz

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal La Negrita se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Norma, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 2  hijos mayores de  edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Norma con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar con los gastos que genera el hogar  se dedica a la venta de sabanas, edredones, almohadas y alfombras,  su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. La mayoría de sus ventas es bajo pedidos que le realizan sus clientes con anticipación. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual ayuda a su marido.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar edredones, sabanas y alfombras. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son muy importantes para su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y su vida familiar.
texts.en:
La Negrita Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Montecristi canton, a place known for its rich pre-colonial culture and recognized nationally and internationally for its handicrafts. This is also the place of the famous panama straw hat.

Sra. Norma lives here. She is 59 years old, married and has two adult children, one of whom still lives with her. Her husband is a trader. 

Doña Norma sells sheets, quilts, pillows and carpets in order to earn something on her own so that she can help with household expenses. She sells door to door and also in her home to her best known customers. Most of her sales stem from orders placed in advance by her customers. She has run this business for more than 10 years in order to help her husband. 

She will use this loan to purchase quilts, sheets and carpets. She has been a member of this credit group since its beginning. She enjoys it because the loans are very important for her business. Her dreams are to continue advancing her business and her family life.

loans.use: to purchase quilts, sheets and carpets.

loans.name: Narcisa Del Jesús

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Dinámicas y Talentosas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio San Pedro en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Narcisa, tiene 48 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Narcisa con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, sabanas y sobrecamas,  su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. La mayoría de sus ventas son bajo pedidos que le realizan sus clientes con anticipación. Tiene 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual ayudo a sus hijos cuando lo necesitaron y ahora le permite ayudara  a su marido con los gastos del hogar.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa y sabanas. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio por lo cual está muy agradecida. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The community bank "Dinámicas y Talentosas" meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of San Pedro in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches, which people visit during every season of the year. It is also known as a city of unequaled beauty and has many tourist attractions.

Narcisa lives in this city. She is 48 years old and has three children with her common-law husband, who is a merchant.  Her children are now grown, and one of them still lives with her.

In order to make some of her own income, Narcisa sells all types of clothing, as well as sheets and bedspreads.  She sells her goods door-to-door and also sells products from her home, where her regular customers come to shop.  The majority of her sales are to order. 

She has been doing this work for 12 years, which has enabled her to help her children when they have been in need, and allowed her to help her husband with the household expenses.

She will use the loan proceeds to purchase clothing and sheets.  She has been with the community bank since its inception.  She likes being a member, since with her first loan she was able to open her business, and for this she is very grateful.  Her dream is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and bedding.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik is from Syunik village in the Syunik region of Armenia. For the past two years, Andranik has worked as a taxi driver. Due to his hard work, Andranik manages to adequately support his family. He is married and the father of two little children. His wife takes care of the household and children and doesn't work, so Andranik is the only breadwinner in the family. 

Currently the car that Andranik drives as a taxi is damaged and needs to be repaired. He has applied for this loan to be able to repair his car and purchase new tires for it. This loan will be a huge support to Andranik, as he will be able to continue with his taxi driving business.

loans.use: to repair his taxi and purchase new tires for it

loans.name: Costasie

texts.en:
Costasie is 44 years old. She is a widow taking care of four children. 

With this loan, she would like to buy more salt for resale. She is expecting to make more profit from her business, and she is planning to use it to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more salt for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 44 years old. She is a mother of five children. She sells clothes, such as shirts and trousers, and other general items at her stall. She has been in the business for the past four years. with the loan, she would like to buy more used clothes for sale, adding to what she has. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet Zainab, she is a 48-year-old woman from the Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children. For the past 11 years, Zainab has been running her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her life. She works at the business seven hours a day, every day. She says that at the moment her business is doing well.

Zainab is asking for a loan in order to buy more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Zainab plans to expand her business as large as she can. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet Isatu, who is 40 years old and from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 6 children.  For the past 11 years, Isatu has been building her retail business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge in her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and cooking oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income resulting from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Isatu plans to open a big palm oil store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and cooking oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Abdunaim

texts.ru:
Абдунаим мужчина среднего возраста,родился и вырос в сельской местности.После окончание средней школы, он начал работать в местном колхозе. Он женат и имеет сына. Его жена домохозяйка,  занимается  домашними  делами.   
Абдунаим сам  доит корову. Полученное молоко он продает соседям по кишлаку. Так он зарабатывает для корма скотов и ежедневные семейные расходы. Конечно же сын ему помогает.
А Абдунаим как все колхозники работает  с утра до вечера.После работы он ухаживать за скотом. Его коллега по работе и друг посоветовал купить ему еще корову,чтобы доход увеличился. А для покупки коровы у него на руках нет столько денежных средств. Абдунаим решил подать заявку на кредит. Он обратился в Арванд за кредитом. Очень надеется на финансовую поддержку и заранее благодарит.
texts.en:
Abdunaim is a middle-aged man who was born and raised in a rural area. He started working at a local farm after graduating from high school. He is married and has a son. His wife is a homemaker and takes care of the household chores. 

Abdunaim milks the cows himself and sells the milk to neighbors in the village. He earns money to feed the cattle, take care of daily expenses, and of course to help his son.

Like all farmers, Abdunaim works from morning to evening and cares for the animals afterwards. His colleague and friend advised him to buy another cow to increase his income, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy one. Abdunaim decided to apply for a loan and hopes for financial support. He thanks Arvand in advance.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Sia

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 37-year-old Sia from the Waterloo eastern rural area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married and blessed with six children. She started her business to take care of her family. 

Sia runs a fish business at home; she sells fish within her community. She has been running this business since 2003. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Sia says that the main challenge to her business is storage facilities.

Sia has requested a loan in order to buy more fish for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and to grow her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Darkangul

texts.ru: Даркангул 47 лет. Совместно с супругом воспитывают пятерых детей. В 2008 году, супруги начали бизнес в торговле продуктами питания с арендованного магазина, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 10,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Даркангул имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, супруги смогли приобрести скот и размножить его, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве у Даркангул имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 20 овец, 1 лошадь, 2 теленка. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Даркангул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - для оптовой покупки продовольственных товаров и прохладительных напитков для последующей розничной торговли. Доходы от кредита Даркангул планирует вложить в увеличение товарооборота.
texts.en:
Darkangul is 47 years old. Together with her husband, she has raised five children. In 2008, the couple started a business of selling food products in a rented store. They used a sum of 10,000 som (KGS) in starting capital. After developing their business and acquiring returning customers, Darkangul has an average income of 15,000 som (KGS). 

Thanks to their persistent work with the business, the couple was able to purchase livestock to breed, and currently Darkangul has two dairy cows, 20 sheep, one horse and two calves on her farm. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Darkangul turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan to purchase food products and beverages wholesale to subsequently sell them as retail goods. Darkangul plans to invest the income from the loan in increasing the turnover.

loans.use: to purchase food products and beverages to sell

loans.name: Maftuna

texts.ru: Мафтуна трудолюбивая женщина. Она в 2006 году вышла замуж, но после 4 лет совместной жизни ее муж заболел и умер. Она осталась вдовой. Мафтуна не имеет детей. После смерти мужа, Мафтуна вернулась в родительский дом. Она не имела источника дохода. Для того чтобы помочь своим родителям, она начала свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Мафтуна сегодня введет успешно свой бизнес. Она имеет своих клиентов. Мафтуна шьёт аккуратно и всегда старается предоставить своим клиентам новые фасоны. Она должна купить новую швейную машинку для своего бизнеса. Однако она не имеет достаточно денег. Мафтуна запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Maftuna is a hardworking woman. She married her husband in 2006, but after four years of marriage her husband became ill and died. She became a widow. Maftuna doesn't have children. After her husband's death, Maftuna returned to her parent's house. She had no source of income. In order to help her parents, she began her own business sewing women's clothing. Today, Maftuna will introduce you to her successful business. She has her own clients. Maftuna sews neatly and always strives to provide her clients with new fashions. She must buy a new sewing machine for her business. However, she does not have enough money. Maftuna is requesting a loan of the sum of 5000 Tajikistani Somoni to buy a sewing machine. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Diane

texts.en:
Diane is 33 years old. She is married with five children.  She sells bricks and has been in this business for the past seven years. 

With this loan, she is planning to buy more bricks for sale. The profits from her business will be used to provide food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more bricks for resale.

loans.name: Lorena Patricia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal La Negrita se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Lorena, tiene 42 años de edad, está separada y de esa relación tienen tres hijos, dos de ellos ya mayores de edad y la menor tiene 14 años y estudia en colegio, con ella también vive una nieta de 5 años que es como su hija ya que la tiene desde pequeñita y estudia en escuela.
Doña Lorena es una mujer muy amable y amiguera que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante y mucho más ahora que está sola, se dedica a la venta de toda clase de productos dependiendo de la temporada, vende ropa, zapatos, sabanas, joyas, juguetes entre otros productos, ella se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Cuenca a comprar las joyas ya que allá le salen mucho más barato, su forma de venta es visitando a sus clientes a quienes les deja a crédito y les cobra por semanas, ya son 15 años dedicada al comercio razón por lo cual tiene mucha clientela.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, sabanas, zapatos y juguetes. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con la ayuda de los créditos todo se le hace más fácil. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijas.
texts.en:
The communal bank "La Negrita" meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton.  The area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are known at the national and international levels.  This is also the place of the famous straw hats. 
This is where señora Lorena lives.  She is 42-years old, is separated and had three children in that relationship.  Two of her children are already grown.  The youngest is 14-years old and goes to high school.  A 5-year old granddaughter also lives with doña Lorena.  She is like a daughter to doña  Lorena, as they have been together since her granddaughter was small.  She goes to school also. 
Doña Lorena is a very kind and friendly person who likes to work to get ahead, even more so now that she is alone. She makes her living selling all kinds of products, depending on the season.  She sells clothing, shoes, sheets, gems and toys, among other products.  She goes to the city of Cuenca to buy the gems, as they are much cheaper there.  She sells her products by going to her customers and leaving the items on credit.  She collects payments on a weekly basis.  Doña Lorena has been running her business for fifteen years, which is why she has such a large clientele. 
This loan is for the purchase of clothing, sheets, shoes and toys.  Doña Lorena has been with the communal bank for three loan cycles.  She likes the communal bank because with the help of the loans, everything is easier.  Doña Lorena's dream is to give her daughters the best education.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, sheets, shoes and toys.

loans.name: Simoni

texts.en:
Simoni is 60 years old. He is married with eight children. 

With this loan, he would like to buy more rice and maize flour for resale. With the profits from the business he is planning to provide food for his family.

loans.use: To buy more rice and maize for resale.

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es:
María nuevamente se decidió por invertir en la compra de abono, plaguicidas, herbicidas, y pago de mano de obra, será de mucha ayudo para tener listo el terreno para sembrar.
Anteriormente el crédito que se le dio le dio resultados positivos, mejoro la calidad de sus granos, aumento el área de siembra,  sus ventas tanto de granos básicos como en el destazo de reses han aumentaron, su economía es más estable, con estos beneficios ha mejorado el ambiente de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María has decided to make a new investment and to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides.  She also will hire laborers.  It will be very helpful so that she can prepare her land for planting.

Her previous loan brought positive results.  She improved the quality of her crops and expanded her area of planting.  She saw an increase in her sales of her crops, as well as her sales of beef.  Her financial situation is more stable, and with the increased income she has been able to improve her family's living environment.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides, as well as to pay for labor.

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Dinámicas y Talentosas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio San Pedro en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 59 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos todos mayores de edad. El mayor está soltero y vive con ellos. El marido no trabaja debido a su avanzada edad.
Doña Ana siempre le ha gustado ganar sus propios ingresos los cuales le han servido para ayudarle a su marido a sacar adelante a su familia, ella desde hace mas de 20 años se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos, preparar sus platos en su casa y entrega a domicilio, trabaja bajo pedidos ya que tiene muchos clientes quienes saben lo delicioso que cocina, ella solo prepara almuerzos de lunes a sábados y los domingos si instala un pequeño puesto cerca del estadio lugar donde vende caldo de gallina y salchichas lo cual es muy solicitado por sus clientes.  Ella también vende ropa en su casa en sus ratos libres.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos y ropa. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The community bank "Dinámicas y Talentosas" meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of San Pedro in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches, which people visit during every season of the year. It is also known as a city of unequaled beauty and has many tourist attractions.

Ana lives in this city. She is 59 years old and has raised six adult children with her common-law husband. Her children are now grown, and one of them still lives with her.  The eldest is single and lives in their home.  Her husband does not work due his advanced age.

Ana has always liked to earn her own income, which has enabled her and her husband to help her family get ahead.  For over 20 years she has prepared and sold food.  She makes her dishes at home and then delivers to her customers.  She makes her meals to order, since she has many customers who know how delicious her food is.  From Monday through Saturday she only makes lunches, and on Sundays she works from a small stand near the stadium, where she sells chicken soup and sausages, which is much in demand from her customers.  She also sells clothing in her spare time.

She will use this loan to purchase clothing as well as supplies to make her food items.  She has been a member of the community bank for four years, and she likes being a member, because the loans are very helpful.  Her dream is to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and clothing.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 23-year-old Aminata from the Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with one child. She began her general store business in 2011 because she wanted to improve their living standard. Aminata works at the business from 8 am to 7 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Aminata has asked for a loan in order to buy more items for resale, like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks and water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to grow her business, and to build a permanent business location. In the future, Aminata plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more items for resale, like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks and water.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Meet 22-year-old Mabinty from the Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children. 

Mabinty started a cosmetics business ten years ago, because she wanted to empower herself and her children. She works at her business 12 hours a day, 7 days a week. She says that the hardest part of her job is moving around door-to-door in order to show her goods to people. 

Mabinty has asked for a loan in order to buy more items like purses, earrings, chains and bracelets for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and develop her family. 

In the future, Mabinty plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more items like purses, earrings, chains and bracelets for resale.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru:
Заррине   39 лет, она замужем. Муж  Заррины потомственный пекарь. Он печет национальные лепешки. Вместе с мужем Заррина  занимается коммерческой деятельностью .  Она помогает мужу выпекать  и реализовывать   национальные  хлебные изделия. Несмотря на это фонд заработной платы их семьи недостаточен для достижение более высоких целей поставленных их семьей т.е. предоставления детям образования на более высоком уровне. У них трое детей.   Каждому из детей  они хотят дать достойное образование  в будущем . Заррина  сотрудничает с МДО «Арванд» на протяжении  более  четырёх лет . Она благодарна МДО  так как с помощью займов предоставленных для развития их бизнеса семья продвигается все ближе к своим целям.
 В очередной раз Заррина обратилась в Арванд за кредитом.  На полученный кредит она хочет купить несколько мешков  муки и продукты для выпечки лепешек.  Заррина заранее благодарит Арванд за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Zarrina is 39 years old and married. Her husband comes from a family of bakers and bakes lepeshka, a traditional bread. Zarrin helps her husband bake and sell traditional breads. However, their current income isn't sufficient for the family to achieve its highest goal of providing their children with a higher education. They have three children and want to give each child a good education in the future. Zarrin has worked with MDO Arvand for over four years and is grateful for the loans that have helped the family develop their business and move closer to achieving their goals. 

Once again Zarrina asked Arvand for a loan. This time she wants to buy a few bags of flour and supplies to bake lepeshka. Zarrina thanks Arvand in advance for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy flour and baking supplies

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet Mariatu. She is an 18-year-old from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is single with no child for now.  


In 2003, Mariatu established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.


Mariatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her parent and increase her business. 


In the future, Mariatu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Darius

texts.en:
Darius is 46 years old. He is a father of six children, aged between 6 and 24. 


With the loan, he would like to buy more plastic cups, bottles and basins for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more retail items, such as cups, bottles and basins, for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy iron corrugated zincs in order to roof his house.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 36 years old. She is married to a businessman and they have six children. She sells shoes and has been running the business for the past six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for resale

loans.name: Fernadi

texts.en:
Fernadi is 43 years old. She is married with seven children. Her husband is a businessman. 

With this loan, Fernandi would like to buy more milk cans for collecting milk for sale. The profits from her business will be used to provide food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more milk for resale.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Inés de 60 años, hace 3 años hizo su retiro jubiloso de su trabajo como empleada e inició simultáneamente su negocio de confecciones de blusas, pantalones etc., actividad que es parte de la tradición de su familia. En su pequeño taller ubicado en su domicilio, realiza todas las operaciones de la confección, trabajando desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche y con ello ha logrado ganar poco a poco la clientela, obtener nuevos ingresos y aprovechar contrataciones como la actual, con ropa quirúrgica. Su sueño de prosperidad es lograr aumentar su capital de trabajo y tener un taller bien posicionado, aumentando mucho más su calidad de vida. En la actualidad  está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una fileteadora, que mejorará la calidad de sus prendas y le permitirá abordar nuevos mercados e incrementar sus ingresos. Con esta inversión Inés está muy entusiasmada y espera hacer que  su credikiva sea muy exitoso.
texts.en:
Inés is sixty years old, and three years ago she retired from her job.  She simultaneously started her own business sewing blouses, pants and other items.  This activity has been a family tradition.  In her small shop located in her home, she performs all the necessary operations, working from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm.  Through this work she has been able to build up a customer base little by little.  She has obtained new income and is able to take advantage of opportunities as they arise.  Currently she has a contract sewing surgical clothing. 

Her dream is to be able to increase her working capital and have a well-positioned shop, which would improve her quality of life very much.  She is currently seeking her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo through Kiva.  She will use the proceeds to purchase a serger (a specialized sewing machine),        which will improve the quality of her clothing items and enable her to enter into new markets and increase her sales.  Inés is very enthusiastic about this investment, and she hopes that this loan will bring her a great deal of success.

loans.use: to purchase a serger (a specialized sewing machine).

loans.name: Pedro's Group

texts.en:
Pedro and Juana live in San Miguel, part of the San Luis Acatlán municipality.  San Miguel is famous for its coffee and its beautiful landscapes, even though they lack many public services, including grid access.  

Pedro is 33 years old and is a happy husband and a loving father of 5 children.  In order to give his family a good quality life, Pedro works as a coffee farmer at his friend Mauricio's coffee plantation, but he also earns a little bit more by working on his own small coffee plantation.  The grains he gets are sold along with his friend's production.  

Pedro dreams of selling his own roasted coffee, but when the working day is over, Pedro has no daylight left to roast the coffee he harvests because his household lacks energy access.  The candles and diesel lamps his family uses for lighting are not enough to perform the coffee roasting task.  Pedro wants to make his coffee business grow in order to offer his 5 children a better future and leave them with a family business.  This is why Pedro wants to purchase a solar home system that will offer enough light to roast his coffee at nighttime, so that he can get started on his roasted coffee business dream.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system to stop using candles and improve his roasted coffee business.

location.town: San Miguel, San Luis Acatlán, Guerrero

loans.name: Monica's Group

texts.en:
Mónica, Juvencio and Gaudiosa live in the state of Guerrero, in the beautiful and small community of Mesón Ixtlahuac, located in the Maninaltepec municipality.  This region lacks energy access and has a complicated landscape.  

Mónica is 47 years old and lives with her parents and her three beautiful children in a small wooden house.  Mónica is the one in charge of her household and family maintenance, which she manages by working hard every day as a farmer on a friend's corn plantation.  When Mónica has spare time, she works on a small coffee plantation she inherited from her husband.  She dreams about achieving more.  She has been thinking about increasing her little coffee production in order to have more stock and sell it in the local market, but her work as a farmer and head of her household is very demanding.  Her three little children help her with everything they can, but at the end of the day Mónica has no daylight to work on the small coffee plantation she owns.  Mónica is not willing to give up, which is why she wants to acquire a solar home system that will be used to light up her small house on the coffee plantation and extend her productive hours during nighttime.  By doing this, she will be able to earn more income and offer a better quality of life to her beloved family.

loans.use: to acquire a solar home system that will allow them extend their productive hours during nighttime.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en: Solange is 29 years old. She is married with four children. She sells shoes and has been in the business for the past eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to providing food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Marget

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Margret from Waterloo, eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with six children. She started the business to take care of her family. 

Margret runs a fish business at home. She sells fish within her community. She has been running this business since 2000. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Margret says that the main challenge to her business is sometimes the purchasing power is very slow.

Margret has requested a loan in order to buy more fish for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 34-year-old Isatu from Waterloo2, eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children. She began her business because she wants to empower herself and her children. For the past 10 years, Isatu established her cosmetics business. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge in her business is to have a permanent business location.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items, such as purses, earrings, chains and bracelets. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and develop her family. In the future, Isatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as purses, earrings, chains and bracelets.

loans.name: Adalberto's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Adalberto, Porfirio and Ponciano live in San Luis Acatlán, a small region located in the beautiful state of Guerrero.  San Luis Acatlán is famous for its warm people and its part of the Mixteca Nahua-Tlapaneca region.  

Mr. Adalberto is 66 years old.  He has lived in the small community of San Miguel all his life, and he has never left it.  He has two jobs - the first one he has had since his childhood as a farmer in farms of different ownerships.  The second one, and in his own words his favorite, is being a proud grandfather of his four grandchildren.  Mr. Adalberto lives with his four grandchildren and his daughter in a small household that lacks energy access.  In order to have light Mr. Adalberto has to walk two hours to the nearest town to buy candles, a task he has been doing since his childhood once a week.  

However, some weeks ago Mr. Adalberto noticed something new at his work.  Almost all the owners of the farms he works for have installed solar home systems to light their hectares.  This made Mr. Adalberto realize that he could work harder and purchase one of those solar home systems for his household.  This will allow his grandchildren to have quality light to do their homework and extend their studying hours, and will allow him to stop relying on hazardous candles and spend more time with his four favorite people in the world.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow them to stop relying on firewood and candles.

location.town: San Miguel, San Luis Acatlán, Guerrero

loans.name: Paz's Group

texts.en: Paz, Lorenzo and Angélica live in the community of Mesón de Ixtlahuac in Malinaltepec, a highly marginalized area located in the state of Guerrero.  As many others, Paz, Lorenzo and Angélica have inherited the trade of harvesting coffee, which can only generate income once a year.  Paz, (anticipating the lack of income for the rest of the year) has invested some money in farm animals, which she sells in the nearest towns.  As well as doing this, she joins Lorenzo and Angélica to work on other lands, but she receives less than $6 USD for a day's work.  In the community of "El Mesón," people like Paz have access to electricity but it rarely works properly.  Because the service is insufficient, they are forced to use candles for lighting purposes.  This alternative source is expensive and does not allow people like Paz to do their productive activities once the sun has set.  By purchasing a solar home system, Paz will be able to carry out her activities and save a considerable amount of money.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will substitute the use of candles

loans.name: Natividad's Group

texts.en: Alfonza and Natividad grew up in the community of "El Mesón" in Malinaltepec, a highly marginalized area in the state of Guerrero.  Alfonza inherited the trade of harvesting corn and coffee from her parents and she intends to pass on this important knowledge to her own two small children.  She lives two hours away from the nearest town and she has never had access to electricity.  As an alternative source, Alfonza asks her children to collect fire wood and "ocote" from the hill and bring it home for them to light their evenings.  By purchasing a solar home system, Alfonza and her children will be able to spend more time together.  Her children will also be able to do their homework better at night.  For Alfonza, being able to pay for this solar home system will be one of her proudest moments.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will substitute traditional lighting sources such as firewood and candles

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet 43-year-old Zainab from Waterloo, eastern area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with two children. She began her business because she wanted to improve her status of living. In 2009, Zainab established her general stock business. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m., 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Zainab requires a loan in order to purchase more items, such as cigarettes, biscuits, drinks, and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her shop. In the future, Zainab plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as cigarettes, biscuits, drinks, and pure water.

loans.name: Sorbeh 1 Group

texts.en:
Alhaji is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Alhaji is 43 years old, and was born in Tombowalla, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a trader, and together they have four children who are of primary and scornadry school age. Alhaji has sold slippers, flip-flops and clothes for more than five years now. 

With the help of this loan, Alhaji and his group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Alhaji will use his share of the loan (1,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy a large quantity of slippers, flip-flops and clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of slippers, flip-flops and clothes to add to his current stock

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Isatu from the Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with seven children. One of her children is still attending school. In 2013, Isatu established her clothing material business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support her home. She works at the business 12 hours a day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of capital.

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more clothing material to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business so she can get a permanent business location. In the future, Isatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
In Givogi village in Vihiga, Kenya, Beatrice has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Beatrice is a hard-working, well-respected 70-year old woman with 10 children. 

Givogi village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected well. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Beatrice and the 10 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Beatrice has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Beatrice volunteered to be the promoter because because she loved the volunteer job description and she wants to help the community to disinfect its water. There are also four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Albert, Rodgers, Catherine and Refa.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Beatrice's community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to reduce the burden of water-borne diseases by providing access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
In Sawani village in Vihiga, Kenya, Rose has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Rose is a friendly, hardworking, reliable and trustworthy member of the community with 3 children. She lives with her family in a house made of mud walls, sand or dirt floor, iron roof.

Sawani village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a borehole. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Rose and the 20 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Rose has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Rose volunteered to be the promoter because she was chosen and is willing to serve the community to help prevent sickness. There are also four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Luka, Mary, Enita and Joash.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Rose’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to improve health and productivity by increasing access to safe drinking water through chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Rosaria

texts.pt:
Rosária, divorciada, mãe de 1 filho e vive na casa cedida. Para além da sua família sustenta também 2 sobrinhos que vivem juntos. 
É comerciante (vende refrigerantes, arroz farinha de milho e outros produtos de primeira necessidade) há mais de quinze anos. 
Com o presente empréstimo de 15.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais produtos para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock.
Tem como sonhos melhorar a dieta alimentar, financiar os estudos do seu filho e sobrinhos e aumentar o fundo de maneio. Tem como principais desafios o furto e a falta de fundos para investimento no negócio.
texts.en:
Rosária is divorced and has a son. She lives in public housing. Aside from her family she also supports two nephews who live in the same place.
She has been a vendor (she sells soft drinks, rice, cornflour and other household staples) for over 15 years.
With the current loan for 15,000mt she intends to purchase more merchandise so that she can meet the demand by stocking up.
Her dreams are to improve her diet, pay for her son's and her nephews' education and increase her working capital. Her main challenges are theft and the lack of funds for investing in her business.

loans.use: to purchase products that are household staples.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.pt:
Angélica, viúva, mãe de 1 filho e vive na casa cedida pelo cunhado. Para além da sua família sustenta também a sua sogra que vive com ela. 
É comerciante avicultora (vende mesas e cadeiras plásticas e dedica-se a criação e venda de frangos) há mais de quinze anos. O seu cunhado apoia na actividade comercial.
